Here’s how to achieve the right amount of sheen An abundance of sebum, the skin’s naturally occurring protective oil, is a good thing. Without it, hair would have no shine and skin no moisture. But overproduction of sebum leads to shiny, oily skin and, often, blemishes. On the face, sebum is emitted from sebaceous glands, predominantly in the T-zone, the forehead, nose and chin.
